questions.text: How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
questions.meaning: Do you find it hard to finish small parts of a task after doing the big important work?
questions.example: Like baking a cake but not feeling like decorating it after it's done.

questions.text: How often do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organisation?
questions.meaning: Is it hard to arrange or plan things properly when you have to be organized?
questions.example: Like packing a suitcase but not knowing what to pack first.

questions.text: How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
questions.meaning: Do you forget important things you planned or agreed to do?
questions.example: Like forgetting you had a doctor's appointment until they call you.

questions.text: When you have a task that requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid or delay getting started?
questions.meaning: Do you avoid or delay starting a task that needs deep thinking?
questions.example: Like needing to write an assignment but scrolling through your phone instead.

questions.text: How often do you fidget or squirm with your hands or feet when you have to sit down for a long time?
questions.meaning: Do you find it hard to stay still, moving your hands or feet when sitting for a long time?
questions.example: Like tapping your pen on the table during a long meeting.

questions.text: How often do you feel overly active and compelled to do things, like you were driven by a motor?
questions.meaning: Do you feel like you have too much energy and can’t sit still?
questions.example: Like always moving around the house without being able to relax.

questions.text: How often do you make careless mistakes when you have to work on a boring or difficult project?
questions.meaning: Do you make small mistakes because the task feels boring or difficult?
questions.example: Like skipping questions on a boring worksheet without noticing.

questions.text: How often do you have difficulty keeping your attention when you are doing boring or repetitive work?
questions.meaning: Is it hard for you to stay focused during boring or repeated activities?
questions.example: Like zoning out while folding clothes or doing paperwork.

questions.text: How often do you have difficulty keeping your attention when you are doing boring or repetitive work?
questions.meaning: Is it hard for you to stay focused during boring or repeated activities?
questions.example: Like losing track of what you’re doing halfway through washing dishes.

questions.text: How often do you have difficulty concentrating on what people say to you, even when they are speaking to you directly?
questions.meaning: Do you zone out and miss parts of a conversation even when someone is talking straight to you?
questions.example: Like someone telling you instructions but you realize you didn’t catch any of it.

questions.text: How often do you misplace or have difficulty finding things at home or at work?
questions.meaning: Do you lose items like keys, phones, or papers even if you just had them?
questions.example: Like setting down your phone and forgetting where it is two minutes later.

questions.text: How often do you leave your seat in meetings or other situations in which you are expected to remain seated?
questions.meaning: Do you get up and move around when you're expected to stay seated?
questions.example: Like getting up during a long classroom lecture even though you’re supposed to stay seated.

questions.text: How often do you feel restless or fidgety?
questions.meaning: Do you often feel like you have to move around because you can't sit still?
questions.example: Like tapping your fingers or bouncing your legs when sitting in a movie theater.

questions.text: How often do you have difficulty unwinding and relaxing when you have time to yourself?
questions.meaning: Is it hard for you to relax even when there’s no pressure?
questions.example: Like lying on the couch but feeling like you have to get up and do something.

questions.text: How often do you find yourself talking too much when you are in social situations?
questions.meaning: Do you sometimes keep talking a lot without realizing in a group setting?
questions.example: Like telling too many stories at a party without noticing others want to speak.

questions.text: When you're in a conversation, how often do you find yourself finishing the sentences of the people you are talking to, before they can finish them themselves?
questions.meaning: Do you jump in and finish people's sentences before they do?
questions.example: Like guessing the end of a friend’s story because you are eager to respond.

questions.text: How often do you have difficulty waiting your turn in situations when turn taking is required?
questions.meaning: Is it hard for you to patiently wait when others are ahead of you?
questions.example: Like feeling very impatient while waiting in a long line at a grocery store.

questions.text: How often do you interrupt others when they are busy?
questions.meaning: Do you interrupt people even when they are busy because you feel your thought can't wait?
questions.example: Like barging into a coworker's discussion because you remembered something important.
